para.sentence: If b and x are fixed, with b>0 and 0<x<1 , then as a\to\infty I_{x}\left(a,b\right)={\Gamma\left(a+b\right)x^{a}(1-x)^{b-1}}\*\left(\sum_{k= 0}^{n-1}\frac{1}{\Gamma\left(a+k+1\right)\Gamma\left(b-k\right)}\left(\frac{x} {1-x}\right)^{k}+O\left(\frac{1}{\Gamma\left(a+n+1\right)}\right)\right), for each n=0,1,2,\dots.
If b=1,2,3,\dots and n\geq b , then the O -term can be omitted and the result is exact.
If b\to\infty and a and x are fixed, with a>0 and 0<x<1 , then (8.18.1), with a and b interchanged and x replaced by 1-x , can be combined with (8.17.4).
Let \xi=-\ln x.

Then as a\to\infty , with b ( >0 ) fixed, I_{x}\left(a,b\right)=\frac{\Gamma\left(a+b\right)}{\Gamma\left(a\right)}\left (\sum_{k=0}^{n-1}d_{k}F_{k}+O\left(a^{-n}\right)F_{0}\right), uniformly for x\in(0,1].

The functions F_{k} are defined by aF_{k+1}=(k+b-a\xi)F_{k}+k\xi F_{k-1}, with F_{0}=a^{-b}Q\left(b,a\xi\right),F_{1}=\frac{b-a\xi}{a}F_{0}+\frac{\xi^{b}e^{-a\xi}}{a\Gamma\left(b\right)}, and Q\left(a,z\right) as in §8.2(i).
The coefficients d_{k} are defined by the generating function \left(\frac{1-e^{-t}}{t}\right)^{b-1}=\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}d_{k}(t-\xi)^{k}.
In particular, d_{0}=\left(\frac{1-x}{\xi}\right)^{b-1},d_{1}=\frac{x\xi+x-1}{(1-x)\xi}(b-1)d_{0}.
Compare also §24.16(i).
A recurrence relation for the d_{k} can be found in Nemes and Olde Daalhuis (2016).
Let x_{0}=a/(a+b).

Then as a+b\to\infty , I_{x}\left(a,b\right)\sim\tfrac{1}{2}\operatorname{erfc}\left(-\eta\sqrt{b/2} \right)+\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi(a+b)}}\*\left(\frac{x}{x_{0}}\right)^{a}\left( \frac{1-x}{1-x_{0}}\right)^{b}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{(-1)^{k}c_{k}(\eta)}{(a +b)^{k}}, uniformly for x\in(0,1) and a/(a+b) , b/(a+b)\in[\delta,1-\delta] , where \delta again denotes an arbitrary small positive constant.
For \operatorname{erfc} see §7.2(i).

Also, -\tfrac{1}{2}\eta^{2}=x_{0}\ln\left(\frac{x}{x_{0}}\right)+(1-x_{0})\ln\left( \frac{1-x}{1-x_{0}}\right), with \eta/(x-x_{0})>0 , and c_{0}(\eta)=\frac{1}{\eta}-\frac{\sqrt{x_{0}(1-x_{0})}}{x-x_{0}}, with limiting value c_{0}(0)=\frac{1-2x_{0}}{3\sqrt{x_{0}(1-x_{0})}}.
For this result, and for higher coefficients c_{k}(\eta) seeTemme (1996b, §11.3.3.2).
All of the c_{k}(\eta) are analytic at \eta=0.
Let \widetilde{\Gamma}(z) denote the scaled gamma function \widetilde{\Gamma}(z)=(2\pi)^{-1/2}e^{z}z^{(1/2)-z}\Gamma\left(z\right), \mu=b/a , and x_{0} again be as in (8.18.8).

Then as a\to\infty I_{x}\left(a,b\right)\sim Q\left(b,a\zeta\right)-\frac{(2\pi b)^{-1/2}}{ \widetilde{\Gamma}(b)}\left(\frac{x}{x_{0}}\right)^{a}\left(\frac{1-x}{1-x_{0} }\right)^{b}\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{h_{k}(\zeta,\mu)}{a^{k}}, uniformly for b\in(0,\infty) and x\in(0,1).

Here \mu\ln\zeta-\zeta=\ln x+\mu\ln\left(1-x\right)+(1+\mu)\ln\left(1+\mu\right)-\mu, with (\zeta-\mu)/(x_{0}-x)>0 , and h_{0}(\zeta,\mu)=\mu\left(\frac{1}{\zeta-\mu}-\frac{(1+\mu)^{-3/2}}{x_{0}-x} \right), with limiting value h_{0}(\mu,\mu)=\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{1-\mu}{\sqrt{1+\mu}}-1\right).
For this result and higher coefficients h_{k}(\zeta,\mu) seeTemme (1996b, §11.3.3.3).
All of the h_{k}(\zeta,\mu) are analytic at \zeta=\mu (corresponding to x=x_{0} ).
For asymptotic expansions for large values of a and/or b of the x -solution of the equation I_{x}\left(a,b\right)=p, if 0\leq p\leq 1, see Temme (1992b).
